content: when thought and the word (la parole) given in writing merge (se confond) at the heart of the same time (au coeur du même temps); chance encounter in singularity of “graph,” coincidence of the cut (la coupure) and the opening (l’ouverture)
linkedContent: when thought and the word (la parole) given in writing merge (se confond) at the heart of the same time (au coeur du même temps); chance encounter in singularity of “graph,” coincidence of the cut (la coupure) and the opening (l’ouverture)

content: yes no longer suffers any metalanguage, all subjects arise from the scene of the yes ——yes’s essential, irreducible infinity: presupposed by negation, opposition, dialectics too
linkedContent: yes no longer suffers any metalanguage, all subjects arise from the scene of the yes ——yes’s essential, irreducible infinity: presupposed by negation, opposition, dialectics too

content: St. Paul: “in Him there has been only Yes (nai)” > de Certeau: this “yes” pierces field of distinctions/separations practiced by Hebraic epistemology
linkedContent: St. Paul: “in Him there has been only Yes (nai)” > de Certeau: this “yes” pierces field of distinctions/separations practiced by Hebraic epistemology

content: de Certeau: knowledge’s procedure is essentially a “no,” mystic postulate advances a limitless “yes”
linkedContent: de Certeau: knowledge’s procedure is essentially a “no,” mystic postulate advances a limitless “yes”

content: de Certeau: “yes” (Ja) and the Separated (Ja, or Jahvé), yes brings together No-Name of Other and Yes of the Volition
linkedContent: de Certeau: “yes” (Ja) and the Separated (Ja, or Jahvé), yes brings together No-Name of Other and Yes of the Volition

content: yes resounds (résonne) in question, always prior to, before, beyond any possible question
linkedContent: yes resounds (résonne) in question, always prior to, before, beyond any possible question

content: quasi-transcendental or ontological structure of yes prescribes double destiny, a destiny of duplicity? ——Nietzsche opposes Ja of innocent affirmation with Ja, Ja of the Christian ass
linkedContent: quasi-transcendental or ontological structure of yes prescribes double destiny, a destiny of duplicity? ——Nietzsche opposes Ja of innocent affirmation with Ja, Ja of the Christian ass

content: quasi-transcendental or ontological structure of yes prescribes double destiny, a destiny of duplicity?

content: Christian yes, a yes of finitude (repetition and memory); Derrida proposes a more ancient root to annul the alternative [limitless singular yes, finite ass yes]
linkedContent: Christian yes, a yes of finitude (repetition and memory); Derrida proposes a more ancient root to annul the alternative [limitless singular yes, finite ass yes]

content: observing separation in Christ’s ‘yes,’ Derrida wants to think a ‘yes’ neither Jewish nor Christian, but quasi, an originary eventness, fable inscribed in the yes—origin of speech (fari)
linkedContent: observing separation in Christ’s ‘yes,’ Derrida wants to think a ‘yes’ neither Jewish nor Christian, but quasi, an originary eventness, fable inscribed in the yes—origin of speech (fari)

content: Rosenzweig: Yea circumscribes as inner limit all that is non-Nought, “Amen” behind every word
linkedContent: Rosenzweig: Yea circumscribes as inner limit all that is non-Nought, “Amen” behind every word

content: “yes” as “silent accompanist,” a little like Kant’s “I think” > Urwort
linkedContent: “yes” as “silent accompanist,” a little like Kant’s “I think” > Urwort

content: is the yes related to volo (will)? or to a more Heideggerian receptivity, the Zusage (pre-engagement) and its relation to Gelassenheit [Eckhart’s Gelâzenheit] (bespeaks non-vouloir)?
linkedContent: is the yes related to volo (will)? or to a more Heideggerian receptivity, the Zusage (pre-engagement) and its relation to Gelassenheit [Eckhart’s Gelâzenheit] (bespeaks non-vouloir)?

content: for Heidegger, the metaphysics of will: interpretation of Being as unconditional will of subjectivity—this hegemony marks all modernity (from Descartes to Hegel, to Nietzsche?)
linkedContent: for Heidegger, the metaphysics of will: interpretation of Being as unconditional will of subjectivity—this hegemony marks all modernity (from Descartes to Hegel, to Nietzsche?)

content: yes: the engagement, the promise to come to language
linkedContent: yes: the engagement, the promise to come to language

content: yes belongs w/out belonging to whole it institutes and opens; it exceeds and punctures (troue) the language in which it remains immanent: first inhabitant of language, first to step out of its home (sortir de chez lui)
linkedContent: yes belongs w/out belonging to whole it institutes and opens; it exceeds and punctures (troue) the language in which it remains immanent: first inhabitant of language, first to step out of its home (sortir de chez lui)

content: de Certeau: w/out object, the verb “to will” close to verb “to pray”
linkedContent: de Certeau: w/out object, the verb “to will” close to verb “to pray”

content: a first yes, given its structure, must be a response, d’abord second, to the other (au prochain); yes, already there nonetheless remains to come (déjà là mais reste pourtant à venir)
linkedContent: a first yes, given its structure, must be a response, d’abord second, to the other (au prochain); yes, already there nonetheless remains to come (déjà là mais reste pourtant à venir)

content: thought of history of Being affected by internal epochē, divides, suspends the yes: will is not identical to itself (along w/ many other things) > yes as the incalculable, the promise: [quasi-, fable of] “giving reason,” “giving an account,” the countability of the innumerable yesses
linkedContent: thought of history of Being affected by internal epochē, divides, suspends the yes: will is not identical to itself (along w/ many other things) > yes as the incalculable, the promise: [quasi-, fable of] “giving reason,” “giving an account,” the countability of the innumerable yesses

content: quasi-analytic: yes never lets itself return to ultimate simplicity, it is the fatality of repetition, repetition as incisive opening (ouverture coupante)
linkedContent: quasi-analytic: yes never lets itself return to ultimate simplicity, it is the fatality of repetition, repetition as incisive opening (ouverture coupante)

content: an analytic must return to structures, whereas yes can only be fictive, fabulous—given over to adverbial dimension of a “quasi”
linkedContent: an analytic must return to structures, whereas yes can only be fictive, fabulous—given over to adverbial dimension of a “quasi”

content: yes must be fictive, quasi, opens every event w/out being itself an event, never present ——any ontology, transcendental statement, presupposes yes, can’t make it it’s theme, quasiment at the beginning
linkedContent: yes must be fictive, quasi, opens every event w/out being itself an event, never present ——any ontology, transcendental statement, presupposes yes, can’t make it it’s theme, quasiment at the beginning

content: “grâce… à la menace de cet oubli [the cutting off, the becoming unique, the divisibility contre laquelle une signature se tend] la mémoire de la promesse, la promesse même peut franchir son premier pas, à savoir le second” ——yes, (already but always) faithful countersignature, can’t be counted: it always sends itself off in number (il s’envoie toujours en nombre)
linkedContent: “grâce… à la menace de cet oubli [the cutting off, the becoming unique, the divisibility contre laquelle une signature se tend] la mémoire de la promesse, la promesse même peut franchir son premier pas, à savoir le second” ——yes, (already but always) faithful countersignature, can’t be counted: it always sends itself off in number (il s’envoie toujours en nombre)

content: the “second” yes, doit arriver comme un renouvellement absolu, the structural “forgetting” of fidelity
linkedContent: the “second” yes, doit arriver comme un renouvellement absolu, the structural “forgetting” of fidelity

content: promise of memory, memory of promise, before all psychē, all morality
linkedContent: promise of memory, memory of promise, before all psychē, all morality

content: forgetting repetition in the promise so that “yes” is absolutely inaugural and “free”
linkedContent: forgetting repetition in the promise so that “yes” is absolutely inaugural and “free”

content: “second” yes a priori enveloped in “first”: doubled in advance, a repetition which opens and threatens w/ forgetting, simulacrum, contamination
